data.title: Meet Our Team
data.meta_description: With Etherio behind you, you’ll tap into a partnership that magnifies your meeting planning prowess and association management strategies.
data.text:
Allison Abney

Senior Director, Site Selection

Allison is responsible for sourcing and negotiating hotel contracts for various large meetings and events, sourcing top properties for our clients that align with their needs. Allison has over 18 years of experience in the events industry. Previously, she worked in the housing Services industry, specializing in housing management and site selection. Allison earned her B.S. in Hospitality Management from the University of Florida. She serves on the Loews Hotel Customer Advisory Board and the Visit San Antonio Customer Advisory Board. Allison has a slight obsession with her Peloton. Her other hobbies include traveling, reading, attending her kids' sporting events, and watching BRAVO TV.

More

Jordan Alexander, CMP

Senior Event Manager

Jordan produces impactful meetings and events for a diverse corporate client portfolio. From agenda management to audio-visual production sourcing, Jordan is involved in every step of the conference management process. She has also served as Etherio's social committee chair, fostering our people-first company culture. Prior to joining Etherio, Jordan worked at PullSpark as an account executive and event producer, working closely with clients to maintain and grow relationships and managing event and video projects. Jordan has also worked for Junior League Golf and the Gwinnett Braves. She is a proud graduate of Clemson University. Jordan has played golf her entire life, and she loves to play in tournaments in her free time!

More

Eric Altschul

Chief Executive Officer

As Etherio’s chief executive officer, Eric’s primary responsibility is to ensure that our team exceeds expectations and fuels growth and success for our clients and the people who matter most to them. He is also focused on ensuring that each team member feels supported and empowered in their role, embodying our core values and noble purpose. Eric brings years of experience in both the travel and meetings industries to his role, learning from many great leaders and mentors. He holds his B.S. in Political Science. Eric supports a number of local charities and non-profit organizations in his hometown. Eric is a travel geek. He loves to research airline flight schedules and collect airline memorabilia.

More

Alissa Archer, CMP, MPA

Director of Events

As director of events, Alissa focuses on project management and logistics for corporate and franchise events. She specializes in budget creation and management, supporting the financial success of our clients. Before she joined Etherio, Alissa was an event manager at AAHOA (Asian American Hotel Owners Association). She has also served as project manager at Omnience Events, where she led a logistics team for IBM World of Watson. She holds her B.S. in Psychology and Business Management and a master's degree in public administration (MPA). Alissa is also a Certified Meeting Professional (CMP). Alissa enjoys guided fly fishing with her husband and organizing closets. She is also an identical twin!

More

Heather Blanchard, CAE

Vice President, Association Management

As vice president of association management, Heather works with our association partners and Etherio team members to provide strategic guidance and operational support, maximizing the success of both our clients and our internal team. Heather brings over 15 years of non-profit leadership experience to her role at Etherio. She has worked in industries ranging from travel & tourism to economic development to an equestrian therapeutic center. Heather graduated Magna Cum Laude from Johnson & Wales University. She is a Certified Association Executive (CAE) and a Travel Marketing Professional (TMP). Heather also holds her Leadership Excellence Certification (LEC). She is involved in the Georgia Society Association Executives and the American Society of Association Executives. Additionally, Heather participates in her city's LEAD Academy and is a member of her local Public Arts Commission. Heather is a proud military brat who values the phrase "home is where the heart is.” She has been in a hot air balloon race, ridden on the wings of a biplane, and was once couple #7 in a Busch Gardens roller coaster wedding.

More

Betsey Blimline, CLP

Marketing Specialist

Betsey supports the International Association of Insurance Professionals as the director of marketing and education. She is responsible for writing, editing, and publishing marketing communications to support the growth of the organization. She also creates and executes the organization's marketing strategy. Betsey brings over 25 years of experience in marketing and communications, primarily for non-profit associations. She has a proven track record of developing professional, creative, and effective marketing strategies. She holds a B.S. in Marketing. Betsey is involved with Atlanta Pet Rescue, where she is a board member, fundraiser, adoption counselor, foster parent, and volunteer trainer. She also volunteers with Furkids, Forsyth County Humane Society, Ruff Dog Rescue, and All About Cats Rescue. Betsey has a passion for pet rescue. Her goal is to become a hospice foster parent for senior dogs and cats, providing them with love in their golden years.

More

Lisa Burton, CMP

Senior Vice President

As the senior vice president of meetings & events, Lisa manges the Etherio Meetings & Events team, overseeing client management, venue sourcing, and event operations. She supports both our internal team members and client teams, providing expert guidance and ensuring that we produce high-quality, impactful meetings and events that fuel success for our clients. Prior to joining Etherio, Lisa gained experience working for a biotechnology association located in Washington, DC and Capitol Hill. Her experience taught her to be adaptable and form strong relationships with clients. Lisa holds a B.A. in Political Science. She is also a member of the Corporate Event Marketing Association (CEMA) and the International Association of Exhibitions and Event (IAEE). Originally from Louisiana, Lisa loves to travel, cook, and attend Louisiana State University sporting events with family and friends. When traveling, she loves trying new food and meeting the local residents.

More

Amaya Castor

Senior Association Coordinator

Amaya serves as the primary contact for member relations at two associations, managing member data and communications. She also supports membership recruitment and retention initiatives, fueling growth for our clients. Prior to joining Etherio, Amaya worked as a human resources intern at a nonprofit organization, where she gained experience in recruitment. Amaya has since honed her project management and recruitment expertise. She holds a bachelor's degree in sociology. Amaya is originally from Long Island, New York. She loves traveling, trying new restaurants, and meeting new people!

More

Kimarie Chang

Senior Director of Events

Kimarie manages and supports a team of event planners serving our clients. She helps create authentic client relationships and memorable experiences, exceeding the expectations of our customers while enriching the lives and careers of her team of planners. Kimarie began her career at The Ritz-Carlton Hotel Company before becoming a meeting planner. She has meeting planning experience spanning non-profits, global corporations, and associations. Kimarie earned her degree in rhetoric and communications from the University of Virginia. She serves as an Advisory Board Member with Fairfax County Stronger Together and volunteers with Women Giving Back. Kimarie is an Atlanta native who is excited to move back to the city to be near friends and family.

More

Beth Chitnis, CAE

Senior Vice President, Association Management

As senior vice president, Beth oversees Etherio’s association management business unit, leading the division in both strategy and operations. She also serves as an account executive for multiple full-service association management clients, inspiring and empowering our team members to create meaningful experiences for our clients and those they serve. Additionally, Beth guides association management teams in all service areas, including governance, leadership development, communications, membership, education, financial management, and event management. Beth brings years of experience in event management, business development, and leadership training to her role. She holds an M.B.A. with concentrations in marketing and organizational management from Emory University’s Goizueta Business School. She obtained her B.S. in Psychology from the University of Illinois at Urbana. Beth also earned her Certified Association Executive (CAE) designation in 2012. She is an active member of Meeting Professionals International, the American Society of Association Executives, the Georgia Society of Association Executives, and the AMC Institute. Thanks to her photographic memory, Beth has an unparalleled ability to recall information. If she’s seen it, she will very likely remember it.

More

Rebecca Clusserath

Senior Association Manager

Rebecca supports the National Property Management Association (NPMA) managing the six certifications offered by the association. She also manages production of The Property Professional magazine, which is produced five times a year. Prior to joining Etherio, Rebecca worked in the higher education sector for nearly 15 years. She began as the director of continuing education at a chiropractic college, where she facilitated re-licensure credit opportunities for chiropractic doctors and managed conferences and events. She also served as a program director at a community college, specializing in training and development. Rebecca holds her B.S. in Psychology. Rebecca enjoys hiking, whether it's on a forest trail or up a challenging mountain path. She takes pride in her accomplishment of conquering the Manitou Incline in Colorado, scaling 2,744 steps!

More

Ragan Cohn

Senior Vice President, Operations, Strategy, and Shared Services

As senior vice president, Ragan’s job is to keep our teams aligned and equipped to fulfill our client-focused purpose and successfully pursue our vision to be best-in-class. That means cultivating culture, leading conversations and initiatives to identify and advance strategic priorities and partnering with other Etherio leaders to keep us always growing and improving. Ragan also has the privilege of leading our marketing, technology, and HR teams. Before joining Etherio, Ragan gained over 20 years of non-profit and association leadership experience, including leading strategic initiatives and operations for a $25M certification organization. After successfully leading our largest association client through a change- and challenge-laden few years, Ragan took on her current leadership role with Etherio. Ragan is a proud graduate of the University of Georgia. She is a current member and past board chair of the Georgia Society of Association Executives (GSAE). Ragan’s favorite season is college football season! (She is a Georgia fan with a soft spot for Clemson and LSU). She is a busy, proud, and happy mom of five who aspires to have time for new hobbies... one day. For now, she enjoys reading while sipping a hot latte!

More

Amy Critzer

Association Director

As the executive director of The Users Group, Inc. (TUG), Amy is responsible for board management, strategic planning, financial management, exhibitor and sponsor sales, and speaker management for events. She works closely with TUG's Education Committee in the process of planning workshops, conferences, and online educational offerings throughout the year. Amy supports both our internal and external client teams to promote the success and growth of the association. Amy brings over 13 years of association management experience to her role. Prior to joining Etherio, she worked in membership at the American Association of Clinical Endocrinologists (AACE). Amy earned her B.S. in Communications with a focus in advertising from the University of North Florida. She is an active member of the Georgia Society of Association Executives (GSAE). Amy enjoys traveling, the beach, iced coffee any time of the year (even if it's snowing), and cheering on the Florida State Seminoles and Jacksonville Jaguars.

More

Karen Daniel

Association Director

Karen serves as the director of marketing and communications for the Oracle Applications and Technology Users Group (OATUG). She is responsible for building awareness about the organization, promoting its products and services to potential members and partners. Karen’s role includes creating and implementing the marketing strategy, overseeing the publication of a quarterly magazine, and social media management. Karen has worked in association and nonprofit marketing for over 35 years. She holds her B.B.A. in Marketing and a Membership Marketing Certificate from the American Society of Association Executives. Karen has also volunteered with her church for many years. Karen loves to travel with her husband, and they usually have at least one trip on the calendar at all times.

More

Natasha Davis

Senior Event Coordinator

Natasha serves clients by supporting the planning and execution of events. Throughout all stages of the planning process, she ensures that each event meets the client's goal, resulting in meaningful impact. Natasha has always been a planner, but she found her passion for event management in college. Since then, she has honed her skills in hospitality and operations. Natasha earned her B.S. in Organizational Communication from Kennesaw State University. Outside of work, Natasha enjoys spending time with family and friends, reading, and attending concerts.

More

Ahmani Dawson, CP

Senior Administrative Coordinator

As the Sr. Administrative Coordinator at Etherio, Ahmani is responsible for facilitating the administration of ADS, which includes managing board communications, planning and coordinating meetings, and handling various other administrative tasks to ensure smooth operations. Her extensive professional experience in the legal field, particularly as a Paralegal and in upper management roles at catastrophic injury law firms, has equipped Ahmani with strong organizational, communication, and management skills that are crucial for effectively executing her responsibilities at Etherio. Ahmani received her B.S. in Integrated Studies, with Specializations in Criminal Justice and Modern Language and Culture, Double minor in Legal Studies and Portuguese Language and Culture from Kennesaw State University. She also has her MPA- Public Administration from Clemson University. Ahmani is actively involved in Sigma Gamma Rho, Sorority, Inc., Member, Cheer P.A.L.S., Founder and Advisor South Carolina Department of Juvenile Justice, Music Volunteer. She has been singing since before she could speak and utilizes any free time she has to explore her musical talent and share it with the world.

More

Jena Dunham

Vice President, Marketing & Creative Services

Jena leads the development and execution of brand and marketing strategies at Etherio, encompassing reputation management, web design, and digital content strategies. She also manages our internal agency, providing comprehensive support to clients across the company's four divisions: Association Management, Incentives, Life Sciences, and Meetings & Events. With nearly 20 years of combined corporate and agency experience, she has served as a brand strategist, specializing in omnichannel B2B and B2C marketing, communications, and brand development. Jena delivers strategies that engage clients, motivate teams, and propel brands forward. She has a B.A. in both Public Relations and Journalism, with a certification in graphic design. She has held board positions with the Virginia Chamber of Commerce, Atlanta Women's Club, and Girls Scouts of Georgia. It's possible that Jena owns every episode or movie of Lucille Ball's career. She is a huge fan of her work and work ethic, and when they say, "I love Lucy," Jena says she loves her more. "If you want something done, ask a busy person. The more things you do, the more you can do." - Lucille Ball

More

Yvonne Escudié

Senior Site Selection Manager

As a senior site selection manager, Yvonne is responsible for sourcing venues and negotiating contracts for meetings and events of all sizes. Yvonne brings a hospitality background in food and beverage management to her role at Etherio. She used her hands-on knowledge to successfully sell conference centers, hotels, and resorts in the southeast. Yvonne carried her hospitality experience into site selection, and she loves finding the perfect venues for clients. She earned her A.A. in English from Miami Dade College and continued coursework in English at the University of Texas at Arlington. Yvonne is a first-generation American and French is her first language. She spent her summers in France growing up!

More

Barbara Fisher

Site Selection Manager

As site selection manager, Barbara oversees sites logistics and contract management for client projects of 100 sleeping rooms or less. She is the primary internal and external client contact and works closely with hotels and CVBs to find the best venues for client events. Barbara assists the site selection team with data management, and she is the primary contact for the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system and Booking Pace Reports. Prior to joining Etherio, Barbara was the executive assistant to the CEO of a hotel purchasing company and managed a vendor program for a hotel franchise company. She received her bachelor's degree from Ohio Wesleyan University. Barbara is an active Children’s Healthcare of Atlanta Diabetes Parent Advisory Board member. She is also the social chair of her neighborhood. Traveling is Barbara’s passion! She has been to 35 states and five continents. She looks forward to making those numbers 50 and seven!

More

Katie Fuller

Vice President, Incentives

As vice president of incentives, Katie has traveled the globe crafting uncommon experiences for some of the world’s most progressive companies. Katie has personally operated incentive programs in more than 45 countries, promoting employee satisfaction and increased productivity. She sources and plans experiences for companies across an array of industries, ensuring that each organization’s incentive experience is curated to meet their needs and goals. As the former director of marketing for a global technology company, Katie has the foundation to bridge both language and international boundaries by connecting a brand message to an experience. Katie received her bachelor's degree in communication with business minor from the University of Alabama. She serves as a board member and co-chair of the mentor program at Covenant House New Orleans. Katie has successfully flown a fighter jet over the Milford Sound (with help from her co-pilot)!

More

Yorke Gale

Account Executive

As an account executive, Yorke manages client relationships and supports our internal team in delivering best-in-class meetings and events for our clients. She identifies opportunities that position our meeting and events team to deliver creative, impactful solutions in support of client retention, growth and success. Before joining Etherio, Yorke was the senior event producer at PRA Business Events. She has over 15 years of experience operating events and managing transportation for an array of corporate clients in a variety of industries. Yorke attended Wofford College, where she earned a degree in business administration and art history. She is the former chapter president of Hospitality Sales and Marketing Association International (HSMAI) Georgia and is a member of Meeting Planners International’s Georgia chapter. Yorke is a mom to two boys. She loves spending time with friends, hiking, live music, k-dramas, baking, cooking, and eating out at restaurants (so she doesn’t have to cook)!

More

Brianna Glouse

Marketing Project Manager

From managing projects and client relationships to assisting with brand strategy, Brianna ensures that Etherio’s marketing team is equipped for success. She serves as the main point of contact for clients and Etherio team members, assisting with projects across the board. Prior to joining Etherio, Brianna gained marketing experience in the financial, building, and legal services industries. Brianna graduated from the University of North Georgia with a degree in business administration with an emphasis in marketing. For many years, Brianna has volunteered with Alzheimer's Association Georgia and Special Olympics Georgia. Brianna is a self-proclaimed “Bravoholic.” If it is Bravo-related, she’s your girl! Reality television is her guilty pleasure — she even attended BravoCon 2022 in New York City!

More

Steve Goodman, CMP

Managing Director

Steve is a member of our Executive Leadership Team, supporting the strategic initiatives, goals, and noble purpose of Etherio. He serves as a liaison to the executive leaders of our clients, creating and maintaining positive relationships in our industry. Steve also supports the Account Executive Team in managing relationships with key supplier partners. Steve is the founder of Jackson Marketing Group and MeetingAdvice, which is part of the Etherio family of brands. He holds his M.B.A. in Business Administration. Steve is a member of the Make-A-Wish Foundation Leadership Council. He also volunteers with the Crohns and Colitis Foundation and Zoo Atlanta. He has chaired over 20 galas supporting numerous nonprofit organizations. Steve has a twin sister! He's also an avid boater and has met numerous members of the Royal Family.

More

Deborah Grant

International Liaison, Editor-At-Large

Deborah produces Insight Magazine, a quarterly digital publication for members of the Oracle Applications & Technology Users Group (OATUG). She promotes the organization and recruits non-members by sharing selected premium content that resonates with the audience. She also builds relationships with the organization’s international members to help expand their global reach. She received her B.A. from the International Christian University in Tokyo and studied for two years in Princeton University’s East Asian Studies Ph.D. program, leaving to start her media company in Los Angeles. Deborah has volunteered at The United Way in Atlanta and the Boys & Girls Club of Venice, California. She has also served on the board of directors for The International Charter Academy of Georgia. At age four, Deborah became famous for sneaking out early in the morning to visit her Japanese neighbors’ homes uninvited. She would often be found happily devouring her preferred breakfast (salted salmon, rice, pickled plum, seaweed, and miso soup) with her bemused Japanese hosts looking on.

More

Alison Griffiths

Finance and Operations Manager

Alison supports the planning, execution, and management of new financial and operational systems, including accounting software, ERP systems, and other related tools. She oversees Etherio's corporate card program, which includes card issuance, account setup, and monitoring card usage. Additionally, Alison supports our internal team by administering technical training programs to enhance team members' financial literacy and proficiency. Alison began her career in the legal industry as a public relations and communications specialist for a healthcare law and medical malpractice defense firm. She served in various law firm administrator roles for 10 years before pivoting to the travel industry, where she started as an office administrator with ABC Global Services. Alison earned her B.S.B.A. from the University of Pittsburgh, where she graduated Magna Cum Laude. Alison is also a public notary and has served as the secretary and treasurer for her homeowner's association since 2016. Alison played 9-ball billiards for the American Poolplayers Association for years, even making it to the National Tournament in Las Vegas.

More

Latonia Hadley

Accounts Payable Manager

As our accounts payable manager, Latonia supports Etherio by processing corporate invoices and expenses. Latonia brings over 20 years of accounts payable experience to her role at Etherio. She earned her B.A.A. in 2007 and her Master's of Accountancy in 2012. Latonia volunteers at Joe DiMaggio hospital and Children's Place at Home Safe in Boca Raton, FL. Latonia loves family time! She and her husband are sports fans. They love keeping up with football, basketball, boxing, and UFC — just to name a few!

More

Amanda Hammerli, CMP

Senior Association Manager

Amanda joined Etherio in 2010 and has since served six association clients in various roles. She is the executive director of the International Association of Insurance Professionals (IAIP), overseeing daily operations, guiding strategy, and supporting the financial success of the organization. Prior to joining Etherio, Amanda was the director of events for Goodwood Museum & Gardens in Tallahassee, Florida, for six years. During her tenure, she supported the completion of the $2.5 million facility, which earned the 2008 ConventionSouth Reader’s Choice Award as a top event facility in Florida. Amanda holds her B.A. from Florida State University. Amanda is involved in the Florida Society of Association Executives, Georgia Society of Association Executives, Junior League of Tallahassee, Suwannee River Area Council, Boy Scouts of America, and Children's Home Society of Florida. In 2015, a group of Etherio team members decided to sign up for a client's 5K event, and Amanda spent about a month "training" for what she thought would be her one and only 5K. Eight years later, she has competed in countless 5Ks and 10Ks. In 2022, she completed her first half marathon. Her proudest running moment was the day her 10-year-old son joined her for his first 5K.

More

Emily Hammonds, MA

Association Manager

As an association manager, Emily manages membership, event registration, and communications for her association client. She is also active on the Etherio Social Committee and assists with The Etherio Times company newsletter, helping foster our company culture. Prior to joining Etherio, Emily gained valuable customer service experience at Walt Disney World and Kaplan Test Prep. She also served as an intern for an event ticketing platform, where she edited content for the website's blog and managed social media accounts. Emily holds a B.A. in English from Shorter University and an M.A. in English from Arizona State University. Emily is a musical theatre-loving history buff who dreams of competing on Jeopardy one day.

More

Tifanie Haun, CMP

Director, Site Selection

As director of site selection, Tifanie searches for, negotiates, and contracts ideal event venues for medium to large groups. She also leads the Atlanta-based site selection team with a focus on operations, ensuring that our processes are best suited to serve our clients. Prior to joining Etherio, Tifanie gained 8 years of experience in convention center sales. She earned her business management degree from Georgia College & State University. Tifanie’s number one bucket list travel destination is to see the Aurora Borealis in Iceland.

More

Patricia Heinel

Human Resources Administrator

Tricia supports our team members by assisting with orientation and onboarding of new employees, maintaining office equipment, and fostering an overall enjoyable work environment and company culture. Tricia brings experience in marketing, meetings and events, and tradeshows to her role at Etherio. She earned her B.S. in Organizational and Corporate Communication with a minor in business administration at Northern Illinois University. Tricia loves to cook, hike, and go boating. She also enjoys drawing in her spare time.

More

Zhajake Henderson

Senior Event Manager

Zhajake is responsible for managing and supporting various events, from the beginning of conception through to the execution, including the day-to-day operation of large-scale/budget meetings, client management, and reporting on ROI. Before her time at Etherio, Zhajake had a decade of experience in event and attendee experience management across diverse industry events, including medical education, technology, and HR. Additionally, she has several years of experience leading brand marketing teams. Zhajake received her Associates in Arts in Business Administration. She started playing the trumpet in the 6th grade and, in the past year, has recently picked up and started practicing again. You can find Zhajake boxing at her local gym 3 times a week and taking tennis lessons once a week. Also, she is a leap year baby so she celebrated her 9th birthday in February of this year!

More

Juliana Hernandez

Event Manager

As an event manager, Juliana manages event budgets, logistics, and vendors to support the success of client events. Juliana brings experience in customer service to her role at Etherio. She received her B.A. in Business Administration from the University of Florida. Juliana’s guilty pleasure is rewatching Gilmore Girls every fall, because she believes there is truly no better time to watch!

More

Christine Hilgert, CMP

Senior Vice President

As senior vice president, Christine focuses on fostering client success, creating meaningful ways to meet objectives, and achieving goals through the attendee journey. She works to ensure that we adapt to our clients’ changing needs, find new opportunities for innovation, and accelerate growth. Christine has worked in the hospitality industry since her first job at a country club at age 15! She’s gained experience in various event management roles throughout her career, working in special events, banquets, and sporting event management prior to joining Etherio. Christine graduated from the Dedman College of Hospitality at Florida State University with a B.S. in Business Administration. She is involved with the Corporate Event Marketing Association and the International Association of Exhibitions and Events. Christine also serves on the Community Action Board of Los Angeles. You can often find her sharing her expertise at industry events or volunteering at Meals on Wheels and Adopt a Golden Atlanta. Christine enjoys travel, paddle boarding, reading, and being outdoors on a sunny day. She loves to learn new things. For example, she earned her Water Sommelier certificate in 2020 and has been a Fencing referrer!

More

Neil Hinkle

Application Support Engineer

Neil supports Etherio on all things related to event technology. He sets up, deploys, and provides support for registration systems, print-on-demand solutions, mobile apps, and association management platforms to support our clients’ growth and success. Before joining Etherio, Neil was the Marketing Manager for 2BigFeet, LLC., focusing on marketing strategy, design, and photography. He has held various roles, including Lead Designer and Marketing Specialist, at Mountville Mills (Now M+A Matting) and their subsidiaries. Neil is also a Cvent Account Administrator and has received multiple Graphic Design USA In-House Design Awards and Signet Adstudy Awards. Neil attended Georgia Southern University where he received his B.F.A. in Graphic Design. Neil volunteers with the Atlanta Ghostbusters, a nonprofit group affiliated with Sony Pictures, where he provides support for parades, local events for cities and museums, hospital visits, and more. Neil loves going to fan conventions such as DragonCon, MomoCon, and Anime Weekend Atlanta. He even makes his own cosplays and loves building detailed prop replicas.

More

James Hobbs

Account Executive

As an account executive, James cultivates strong senior executive client relationships, formulates educational and networking programming solutions, assists with event planning and execution, supports our internal and external client teams. James brings over 17 years of experience with in-person, hybrid and virtual events to his role. He also has experience with association management, with expertise in operations, project management, strategic planning, and contract negotiation. James earned his B.A. in Art History from Texas Tech University. James is an artist at heart with a drive to make events a more beautiful place to be. Great design, thought provoking art, exceptional food, good wine, and good company are all his favorite things.

More

Lexie Hogge

Exhibitor and Sponsor Specialist

As an exhibitor and sponsor specialist, Lexie works with the International Orthopedic Education Network (IOEN) to manage sponsor relationships and ensure success for educational conferences. She builds and maintains valuable relationships in the medical industry to garner support and ensure growth for IOEN. Prior to joining Etherio, Lexie worked in the orthopedic industry, building the knowledge and relationships needed to produce medical education meetings. Additionally, Lexie has over 20 years of event planning experience for a variety of organizations. Lexie holds a degree in broadcasting and a Federal Communications Commission (FCC) license. Lexie has six children, and they are an extremely active family. They love to wakeboard, hike, snowboard, camp, and play sports!

More

Darnette Holbert

Senior Event Manager

As a senior conference manager, Darnette focuses on conference logistics, speaker management, and sponsor management. She is responsible for collaborating with both the internal and client team to ensure the planning process runs smoothly and the event meets our client’s needs and goals. Before joining Etherio, Darnette worked as a corporate meeting planner for Blockbuster for more than ten years. Additionally, she was a contractor for the National Hockey League and worked with an agency focused on oncology conferences offering medical CEUs. Darnette earned her B.A. from Florida State University. She volunteers with St. Jude Children's Healthcare, Children's Healthcare of Atlanta, and Habitat for Humanity. Darnette is a big sports fan — college and pro football, hockey, and racing (F1 and Indy) being her main passions. She also loves to read a good thriller or mystery novel!

More

Kristen Hopper

Senior Account Director

At Etherio, Kristen is the Senior Account Director for the BCoD Association and is responsible for overall administration and operation of the organization. This role advises and assists the BCoD in formulating and implementing strategies, objectives and policies to advance the organization’s mission. Kristen has developed and managed sponsorship programs for many organizations – connecting industry with their target audiences and creating win-win opportunities. Working on the largest conferences in the eyecare industry, she collaborated with multiple audiences to develop a program to engage the next generation of professionals – resulting in increased attendance and participation. She received her Bachelor’s degree in communications with a focus in marketing from Missouri State University and Associate's Certificate in Project Management from The George Washington University. Her accomplishments continue with Vision Monday’s Most Influential Women in Optical in 2018 and Optical Women’s Association’s (OWA) Leadership Scholarship Award in 2020. Kristen serves on committees for the OWA and is the Professional Development Chair for The Vision Council’s Emerging Optical Leaders Committee. She has held leadership positions for various Alpha Chi Omega Alumni Associations, the Jaycees, and the Foster and Adoptive Care Coalition.

More

Trish Huntley, CMP

Senior Event Manager

As a senior event manager, Trish supports Etherio’s clients and internal teams, creating impactful events while maintaining operational excellence and financial management. Trish began her career in hotel and hospitality management. She later shifted to event planning in large corporate settings, managing executive events hosted by the highest-level C-suite executives of global corporations. She earned her B.S. in Business Administration from Bryant University, majoring in hospitality marketing. Trish resides in Connecticut with her husband, son, and three hunting dogs. They love all things outdoors: pheasant hunting, pickleball, golf, skiing, and taking in the fresh air!

More

Natalia Hurd, CMP

Conference Planner

As a conference planner, Natalia supports each phase of the conference management process, from buidling out conference agenda to managing speakers to handling confernece logistics. She supports both the internal and client teams to ensure the delivery of best-in-class conferences. Prior to Etherio, Natalia served as a marketing program coordinator at Genuine Parts Company (NAPA), supporting all aspects of project execution and coordination of corporate meetings and events. She is a graduate of the University of Central Florida, where she earned her degree in event management from the Rosen College of Hospitality Management. Natalia is a member of Meeting Professional International (MPI) Georgia. Natalia is originally from Russia and speaks two languages.

More

Stacey Jackson

Senior Event Manager
